items.title: CVE-2026-26198
items.key_takeaway: Ormar 0.9.9–0.22.0 permits SQL injection via min() and max() aggregate calls; upgrade to >=0.23.0 to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-26331
items.key_takeaway: yt-dlp <2026.02.21 allows command injection via the --netrc-cmd option; upgrade to >=2026.02.21 or avoid using this option.

items.title: CVE-2026-27952
items.key_takeaway: Agenta API versions before 0.48.1 allow sandbox escape via a whitelisted numpy package, enabling arbitrary code execution; upgrade to >=0.48.1 (or later 0.60+) to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27966
items.key_takeaway: Langflow versions prior to 1.8.0 hardcode allow_dangerous_code=True in the CSV Agent node, exposing a Python REPL that permits arbitrary code execution via prompt injection; upgrade to >=1.8.0 to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2025-69985
items.key_takeaway: FUXA versions <=1.2.8 trust the HTTP Referer header for internal request validation, enabling unauthenticated JWT bypass and remote code execution via the /api/runscript endpoint; upgrade to a patched release or modify the middleware to properly verify authentication.

items.title: CVE-2026-27699
items.key_takeaway: basic-ftp versions <5.2.0 allow path traversal in downloadToDir(), enabling malicious FTP servers to write files outside the target directory; upgrade to >=5.2.0 to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27903
items.key_takeaway: minimatch versions before the fixed releases can be forced into exponential backtracking by crafted glob patterns, stalling the Node.js event loop for seconds; upgrade to a patched version (>=10.2.3, 9.0.7, 8.0.6, 7.4.8, 6.2.2, 5.1.8, 4.2.5, 3.1.3) to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27959
items.key_takeaway: Koa versions <3.1.2 (or <2.16.4) allow Host header injection via ctx.hostname parsing; upgrade to >=3.1.2 or >=2.16.4 to prevent attacker-controlled hostname usage.

items.title: CVE-2026-27208
items.key_takeaway: bleon-ethical/api-gateway-deploy v1.0.0 allows OS command injection and privilege escalation leading to container escape; upgrade to v1.0.1 and enforce non‑root user to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27899
items.key_takeaway: WireGuard Portal versions before 2.1.3 allow any authenticated non-admin user to become an admin by setting "IsAdmin": true in their profile update request; upgrade to v2.1.3 (or newer Docker images) to fix the issue.

items.title: CVE-2026-2794
items.key_takeaway: Firefox versions prior to 148 are vulnerable to information disclosure via uninitialized memory; upgrade to Firefox 148 or later to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-2800
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for Android and Thunderbird versions prior to 148 have a critical WebAuthn spoofing vulnerability; upgrade to version 148 or later to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-2634
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for iOS versions before 147.4 have a critical address‑bar spoofing vulnerability; ensure iOS users update to Firefox 147.4 or later to prevent domain spoofing attacks.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Testing Guide (MASTG)
items.key_takeaway: The updated OWASP MASTG provides a comprehensive, up‑to‑date methodology and test cases for securing iOS and Android mobile apps, essential for guiding security testing and secure development practices.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS)
items.key_takeaway: MASVS defines a comprehensive set of security requirements for mobile apps—covering architecture, data storage, cryptography, authentication, network, platform interaction, code quality, and resilience—providing a verification baseline for secure iOS/Android development.

items.title: OWASP Top 10 for Web Applications
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP Top 10 provides a concise, up‑to‑date awareness framework of the most critical web application security risks, guiding developers and security reviewers to prioritize mitigation in VA/healthcare web apps.
